alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Noble; Payne (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Lincoln, southern Noble, central Logan and Payne Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Lucien to 3 miles northwest of Mulhall to near Crescent. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stillwater, Guthrie, Perry, Perkins, Langston, Crescent, Carney, Glencoe, Tryon, Ripley, Coyle, Cedar Valley, Mulhall, Cimarron City, Orlando, Meridian, Fallis, Lake Carl Blackwell, Lake Mcmurtry and Lucien. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 153 and 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
